summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). It details multiple trips planned between March 2019 and February 2020 to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Recipient and approver of multiple travel requests for the Epstein investigation team. His email signature indicates he is with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary requester submitting multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team to conduct interviews in various locations. The signature identifies Alex as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Team member on the Epstein investigation, mentioned as a traveler for interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles. She also requests a personal weekend extension on a work trip to Los Angeles in February 2020.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Team member on the Epstein investigation, mentioned as a traveler for interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles alongside Alex and Alison.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on several travel approval request emails within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on a travel approval request email. Her email address is from the usa.doj.gov domain.

persons.name: Darlene A. Alleyne
persons.context: Consistently copied on travel approval request emails, likely in an administrative or support role for the investigation team.

connections.description: Alex submits travel requests to Edward Tyrrell for approval, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or requester-approver relationship within the USAO.
They are mentioned as traveling together as part of the same investigation team for interviews.
They are mentioned as traveling together as part of the same investigation team for interviews.
They are mentioned as potential travel pairs for investigation trips to West Palm Beach.

events.title: Planned Florida Interviews
events.description: Alex and an unnamed colleague request travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida for two days of meetings and interviews related to the Epstein case.

events.title: West Palm Beach Travel
events.description: Alex and Alison request permission to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida for approximately three days for meetings and interviews.

events.title: West Palm Beach Meetings
events.description: The team requests travel to West Palm Beach for victim interviews. The traveling team could be Alex and Alison or Alison and Maurene.

events.title: Los Angeles Victim Interview
events.description: The team requests travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview. The trip involves Alex, Alison, and/or Maurene.

events.title: West Palm Beach Interview
events.description: Alex and Maurene request travel to West Palm Beach for an interview.

events.title: Los Angeles Interview
events.description: The team requests travel to Los Angeles for an interview.

events.title: Los Angeles Interviews
events.description: The team requests travel to Los Angeles for an interview or interviews.

events.title: Stockholm, Sweden Interview
events.description: The team requests travel for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, indicating an international dimension to the investigation.

events.title: Los Angeles Interview Series
events.description: The team requests travel to Los Angeles for three interviews scheduled on February 26, 27, and 28.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing investigative activity for case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618' well after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, extending into February 2020.
The investigation involved international travel, with a planned interview near Stockholm, Sweden in January 2020.
The primary purpose of the travels was to conduct victim interviews, as explicitly stated in several requests.
The investigation team from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York included AUSA Alex and investigators Alison and Maurene.
Travel and logistical approvals were managed through internal DOJ email correspondence with supervisor Edward Tyrrell.
